content.new: At present only `X1` → `X1/base` is published as a static transform. There are number of transforms from `X1/base` to sensors, which are mechanically static, but are published as non-static transforms eating up the bandwidth. Is there a reason for it? Can it be changed?
content.old: At present only `X1` → `X1/base` is published as a static transform. There are number of transforms from `X1/base` to sensors, which a mechanically static, but are published as non-static transforms eating up the bandwidth. Is there a reason for it? Can it be changed?

issue.title: Why not use more static transforms?
